nodes.text: Silk weave dusk capes were a type of hooded cape available in brown around five years before the Battle of Yavin. The street urchin Ezra Bridger included one of the capes on a wishlist he compiled in his journal. He believed the cape looked stylish and could be used for camouflage during the night.
Silk weave dusk capes were first mentioned in Rebel Journal by Ezra Bridger, a reference book written by Daniel Wallace and published in 2014.
